Bastian' (26 June 1826 â 2 February 1905) was a 19th century polymath best
remembered for his contributions to the development of ethnography and the
development of anthropology as a discipline. Modern psychology owes him a great
debt, because of his theory of the Elementargedanke, which led to Carl Jung's
development of the theory of [[archetype]]s, besides influencing work of
comparative mythologist Joseph Campbell. Campbell, Joseph. The Masks of God:
Primitive Mythology, p. 32. London: Secker & Warburg: 1960. "Jung's idea of the
"archetypes" is one of the leading theories, today, in the field of our subject.
